content.raw:
The current interfaces between gazebo and bullet are in the `gazebo/physics/bullet` folder:

#!/osrf/gazebo/src/default/gazebo/physics/bullet/

Also, we currently search for bullet 2.82 in [cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8efd18f7a322cb5945634f060197de24a65ac1ed/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake?at=default#cl-364). The bullet3 master branch currently has [version number of 2.83](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L8) and has had a [2.83 alpha release](https://github.com/bulletphysics/bullet3/releases/tag/Bullet-2.83-alpha), but no official 2.83 release yet. So to build bullet3 from source, one should increment the version that gazebo searches for to 2.83.

The bullet3 repository also has the bullet 2 API in parallel with the bullet3 API. So presumably, we should make sure gazebo works with 2.83, and then figure out how to connect to the new API.

Sorry I don't have any more concrete suggestions than that. I'm not actively working on this right now. Feel free to post your progress and questions here, and we'll try to be of assistance.
